intro: Calandrinia nivalis, commonly known as the snow calandrinia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant pink to red flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Calandrinia nivalis is often used in rock gardens and as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and aesthetic appeal.
